Package de.matthiasfisch.mysticlight4j.api

Class MysticLightAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.matthiasfisch.mysticlight4j.api.MysticLightAPI
  • public class MysticLightAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the low-level access to the functions from the Mystic Light SDK. If you want to use object oriented access, please have a look at MysticLight4j instead. The methods in this class directly correspond to the native functions from the SDK. For documentation please confer to the official documentation by MSI. Before calling any method of this class it is required to call initialize() or its overloading variants once in order to load the native DLL and initialize the SDK. For the SDK to properly work it is required that the process runs with elevated (administrator) privileges. To check this the method isProcessElevated() is provided for convenience.

    • Method Detail

      • isProcessElevated

        public static boolean isProcessElevated()
        Interaction with the Mystic Light API requires the process to run with administrator privileges. This is a helper method for checking if the process is running with elevated privileges and is not actually part of the Mystic Light API.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the JVM is running with elevated privileges.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize()
                       throws MysticLightAPIException
        Initializes the Mystic Light API. This method must be called before any other method of the Mystic Light API is called. This method searches for the native DLL for the current system architecture in the current working directory. If you the native DLLs are located elsewhere and you want to specify their location use initialize(Path) instead. This method will only load the DLL and initialize the SDK the first time it is called. Thereafter it will do nothing and it is safe to call it again.
        Throws:
        MysticLightAPIException - Thrown if the native function does not return MLAPI_OK.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize​(@NonNull
                              @NonNull java.nio.file.Path path)
        Initializes the Mystic Light API loading the native DLL from the specified path. This method must be called before any other method of the Mystic Light API is called. This method will only load the DLL and initialize the SDK the first time it is called. Thereafter it will do nothing and it is safe to call it again.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the native DLL for the system architecture or to a directory containing this file.

      • loadNativeDll

        public static void loadNativeDll​(@NonNull
                                 @NonNull java.nio.file.Path path)
        Loads the native DLL providing the bindings the the functions of the Mystic Light SDK. This method must be called before calling any other method of this class except for initialize() and its overloading variants (as these implicitly call this method if not done already).
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the native DLL for the system architecture or to a directory containing this file.

      • getDeviceInfo

        public static DeviceInfo[] getDeviceInfo()
                                  throws MysticLightAPIException
        Returns information about all installed devices that are compatible with Mystic Light. The information contains a device ID and the number of LEDs of the device.
        Returns:
        Returns information about all Mystic Light devices installed.
        Throws:
        MysticLightAPIException - Thrown if the native function does not return MLAPI_OK.

      • getLedInfo

        public static LedInfo getLedInfo​(@NonNull
                                 @NonNull java.lang.String device,
                                 int index)
                          throws MysticLightAPIException
        Returns information about a specific LED of a Mystic Light device. This information contains the name of the LED and the styles supported by the LED.
        Parameters:
        device - The identifier of the device the LED belongs to. This is a value as returned by getDeviceInfo().
        index - The index of the LED.
        Returns:
        Returns information about the specifed LED.
        Throws:
        MysticLightAPIException - Thrown if the native function does not return MLAPI_OK.

      • getLedName

        public static java.lang.String[] getLedName​(@NonNull
                                            @NonNull java.lang.String device)
                                     throws MysticLightAPIException
        This function retrieves the all LED name within LED area of specific device. Note: This function apparently may return an empty array for some devices despite there are LEDs accessible.
        Parameters:
        device - The identifier of the device the LED belongs to. This is a value as returned by getDeviceInfo().
        Returns:
        Returns the names of the LED.
        Throws:
        MysticLightAPIException - Thrown if the native function does not return MLAPI_OK.

        Returns:

      • setLedStyle

        public static void setLedStyle​(@NonNull
                               @NonNull java.lang.String device,
                               int ledIndex,
                               @NonNull
                               @NonNull java.lang.String style)
                        throws MysticLightAPIException
        Sets the active style of a LED of a specific Mystic Light device.
        Parameters:
        device - The identifier of the device the LED belongs to. This is a value as returned by getDeviceInfo().
        ledIndex - The index of the LED.
        style - The style to set. Must be one of the styles returned by getLedInfo(String, int) for this LED.
        Throws:
        MysticLightAPIException - Thrown if the native function does not return MLAPI_OK.

      • setLedBright

        public static void setLedBright​(@NonNull
                                @NonNull java.lang.String device,
                                int ledIndex,
                                int level)
                         throws MysticLightAPIException
        Sets the brightness value of a LED of a specific Mystic Light device.
        Parameters:
        device - The identifier of the device the LED belongs to. This is a value as returned by getDeviceInfo().
        ledIndex - The index of the LED.
        level - The brightness level to set. Must be a value between 0 and getLedMaxBright(String, int).
        Throws:
        MysticLightAPIException - Thrown if the native function does not return MLAPI_OK.

      • setLedSpeed

        public static void setLedSpeed​(@NonNull
                               @NonNull java.lang.String device,
                               int ledIndex,
                               int level)
                        throws MysticLightAPIException
        Sets the speed level of a LED of a specific Mystic Light device.
        Parameters:
        device - The identifier of the device the LED belongs to. This is a value as returned by getDeviceInfo().
        ledIndex - The index of the LED.
        level - The speed level to set. Must be a value between 0 and getLedMaxSpeed(String, int).
        Throws:
        MysticLightAPIException - Thrown if the native function does not return MLAPI_OK.
